title: Climate refugia for red abalone
text: abalone package documents functions used throughout postdoc defining mapping climate refugia red abalone across California. project funded California’s 5th Assessment Climate Change.

what: Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
title: Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
text: function uses sf package read one included shapefiles bundled package. Jessie standardized .

title: Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
text: shapefiles stored /extdata. Available shapefiles: usa: usa_contiguous.shp eez: westcoast_eez.shp. Derived 'Marine Regions' dataset: https://www.marineregions.org/ contshelf50: cont_shelf_50m.shp. Derived GEBCO 2024 contshelf200: cont_shelf_200m.shp. Derived GEBCO 2024. mpas: california_mpas.shp. CDFW dataset: 'California Marine Protected Areas ds582', representing MPAs 1 Jan, 2019.

title: Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
text: shape One default shapefiles use. Options : "usa" – contiguous United States land boundary. "eez" – U.S. West Coast EEZ "contshelf50" – 50 m isobath "contshelf200" – 200m isobath (.e., continental shelf) "mpas" – Californian marine protected areas

title: Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
Read in shapefiles provided by this package — read_shp
code: shp <- read_shp("usa") shp #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -124.7346 ymin: 24.54255 xmax: -66.97732 ymax: 49.36949 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   FID                       geometry #> 1   0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-122.7411 4... plot(shp)
